private_information: I arrive at Alamo Square at 09:00
I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
Travel times: AlamoSquare to SunsetDistrict 16 minutes, SunsetDistrict to AlamoSquare 17 minutes
traveler.goal: Plan a schedule to meet friends maximizing meetings and ensure meeting Matthew for at least 15 minutes between 13:30 and 14:30 at Sunset District if possible

private_information: I will be at Sunset District from 13:30 to 14:30
I can meet for a minimum of 15 minutes within my availability window
matthew.goal: Meet the traveler at Sunset District for at least 15 minutes sometime between 13:30 and 14:30

orchestrator.goal: Orchestrate the travelers schedule to maximize meetings and satisfy constraints including meeting Matthew at Sunset District for at least 15 minutes within his availability

public_information: You are visiting San Francisco for the day
Travel time from AlamoSquare to SunsetDistrict is 16 minutes
Travel time from SunsetDistrict to AlamoSquare is 17 minutes
Matthew will be at SunsetDistrict from 13:30 to 14:30 and requires a minimum 15 minute meeting

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward solver and keep temporal and durative actions if needed.
pddl.prompt: Your name is traveler. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->traveler->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->traveler->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownward that captures your movement between locations, time windows, travel durations, and the requirement to meet Matthew for at least 15 minutes. If information is missing do not assume extra data; produce a plan consistent with what you know. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward solver and represent availability windows and minimum meeting durations.
pddl.prompt: Your name is matthew. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->matthew->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->matthew->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownward that captures your availability window at SunsetDistrict and the minimum meeting duration requirement. If information is missing do not assume extra data; produce a plan consistent with what you know. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents keep their actions distinct and label them clearly. Integrate temporal constraints and availability windows to produce a coherent schedule.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are two agents planning to solve the task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to integrate them to solve: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind the PDDL input may be partial or contain ambiguous names. Here is the first agent input: {pddl_traveler} Here is the second agent input: {pddl_matthew} Integrate the two PDDL descriptions, resolve naming mismatches, keep actions of the two agents distinct, represent travel durations and time windows, and produce a combined PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward that yields a schedule maximizing meetings while guaranteeing a meeting with Matthew of at least 15 minutes within his availability. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
